revised_title: The Valve Maintained Tuning Fork as a Primary Standard of Frequency: Experiments and Design
tldr: This article presents an investigation into the constancy of frequency from a valve maintained tuning fork, leading to the design of a cycles per second fork as a primary standard of frequency. The authors discuss the design of the fork unit, the effect of prong loading on the fork's logarithmic decrement, and the relationship between frequency and amplitude. The results demonstrate the potential of the valve maintained tuning fork as a reliable frequency standard for various applications.
